item.text: Solomon took 13 years to build his palace.

He <st data-num="01129" class="">named</st><n id="1" /> it “The <st data-num="01004" class="">Palace</st> of the <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st> <st data-num="03293" class="">Forest</st>”;<n id="2" /> it was <st data-num="03967 0520">150 feet</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st>, <st data-num="02572 0520">75 feet</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>, and <st data-num="07970 0520">45 feet</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="06967" class="">high</st>. <st data-num="05921" class="">It had</st> <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> of <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st> and <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="03773" class="">beams</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">above</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>.

The <st data-num="05603" class="">roof</st> <st data-num="04605 05921">above</st> the <st data-num="06763" class="">beams</st> <st data-num="0834 05921">supported by</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st> was also made of <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st>; there were <st data-num="0705 02568" class="">45</st> beams, <st data-num="02568 06240">15</st> per <st data-num="02905" class="">row</st>.

There were <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> of <st data-num="08261" class="">windows</st> <st data-num="04237 0413 04237">arranged</st> in <st data-num="06471" class="">sets</st> of <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="06607 04201">entrances</st><n id="1" /> were <st data-num="07251" class="">rectangular</st> in <st data-num="08260" class="">shape</st><n id="2" /> and they were <st data-num="04136 04237 0413 04237">arranged</st> in <st data-num="06471" class="">sets</st> of <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st>.<n id="3" />

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="0197 05982">colonnade</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02572 0520">75 feet</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0753" class="">long</st> and <st data-num="07970 0520">45 feet</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="07341" class="">wide</st>. There was a <st data-num="0197" class="">porch</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of this and <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st> and a <st data-num="05646" class="">roof</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of the porch.<n id="4" />

He also <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="03678" class="">throne</st> <st data-num="0197" class="">room</st>, <st data-num="08033" class="">called</st> “The <st data-num="0197" class="">Hall</st> of <st data-num="04941" class="">Judgment</st>,” <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> he <st data-num="08199" class="">made judicial decisions</st>.<n id="1" /> It was <st data-num="05603" class="">paneled</st> with <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> from the <st data-num="07172" class="">floor</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06982" class="">rafters</st>.<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st> <st data-num="0834 08033">where</st> he <st data-num="03427" class="">lived</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="02691 0312 01004 0197">constructed</st> in a <st data-num="02088" class="">similar</st> <st data-num="04639" class="">way</st>.<n id="1" /> He also <st data-num="06213" class="">constructed</st> a <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st> like <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="0197" class="">hall</st> for <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh’s</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">he</st> had <st data-num="03947" class="">married</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> were built with the <st data-num="03368" class="">best</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>, <st data-num="01496" class="">chiseled</st> to the <st data-num="04060">right size</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="01641" class="">cut</st> with a <st data-num="04050" class="">saw</st> on <st data-num="01004 02351">all sides</st>,<n id="3" /> from the <st data-num="04527" class="">foundation</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02947" class="">the edge of the roof</st><n id="4" /> and from the <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st>.

The <st data-num="03245" class="">foundation</st> was made of <st data-num="01419" class="">large</st> <st data-num="03368" class="">valuable</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>, <st data-num="068" class="">measuring either</st> <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st> <st data-num="068" class="">or</st> <st data-num="08083 0520">12 feet</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="04605" class="">Above</st> the foundation<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03368" class="">best</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>, <st data-num="01496" class="">chiseled</st> to the <st data-num="04060" class="">right size</st>,<n id="3" /> were used along with <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st>.
Around the great courtyard were three rows of chiseled stones and one row of cedar beams, like the inner courtyard of the Lord’s temple and the hall of the palace.
King Solomon sent for Hiram of Tyre.

He was the son of a widow from the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a craftsman in bronze from Tyre. He had the skill and knowledge to make all kinds of works of bronze. He reported to King Solomon and did all the work he was assigned.
He fashioned two bronze pillars; each pillar was 27 feet high and 18 feet in circumference.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03332 05178">bronze</st> <st data-num="03805 ">tops</st> <st data-num="05414 05921 07218">for</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>; <st data-num="03805 0259 03805 08145">each</st> was <st data-num="02568 0520">7½ feet</st> <st data-num="06967" class="">high</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="07638" class="">latticework</st> on the <st data-num="03805" class="">tops</st> <st data-num="0834 05921 07218">of</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st> was <st data-num="04639" class="">adorned</st> with <st data-num="07639" class="">ornamental</st> <st data-num="01434" class="">wreaths</st> and <st data-num="08333" class="">chains</st>; the <st data-num="03805" class="">top</st> of <st data-num="0259" class="">each</st> <st data-num="08145" class="">pillar</st> had <st data-num="07651" class="">seven groupings of ornaments</st>.<n id="1" />

When he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>, there were <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> of <st data-num="07416" class="">pomegranate-shaped ornaments</st> <st data-num="05439 05921">around</st> the <st data-num="07639 0259">latticework</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">covering</st> the <st data-num="03805" class="">top</st> <st data-num="0834 05921 07218">of</st> each <st data-num="05982 03651 06213 03805 08145">pillar</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="03805" class="">tops</st> <st data-num="0834 05921 07218">of</st> the two <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st> in the <st data-num="0197" class="">porch</st> were <st data-num="04639" class="">shaped</st> like <st data-num="07799" class="">lilies</st> and were <st data-num="0702 0520">six feet</st> high.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="05921" class="">On</st> the <st data-num="03805" class="">top</st> of <st data-num="08147" class="">each</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">pillar</st>, <st data-num="05980" class="">right</st> <st data-num="01571 04605">above</st> the <st data-num="0990" class="">bulge</st> <st data-num="0834 05676">beside</st> the <st data-num="07639" class="">latticework</st>, there were <st data-num="03967" class="">200</st> <st data-num="07416" class="">pomegranate-shaped ornaments</st> arranged in <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> <st data-num="05921 03805 08145">all the wa</st>y <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st>.<n id="1" />

He <st data-num="06965" class="">set up</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st> on the <st data-num="0197" class="">porch</st> in front of the <st data-num="01964" class="">main hall</st>. He <st data-num="06965" class="">erected</st> one <st data-num="05982" class="">pillar</st> on the <st data-num="03233" class="">right<n id="1" /> side</st> and <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">it</st> <st data-num="03199" class="">Yakin</st>;<n id="2" /> he <st data-num="06965" class="">erected</st> the other <st data-num="05982" class="">pillar</st> on the <st data-num="08042" class="">left<n id="3" /> side</st> and <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">it</st> <st data-num="01162" class="">Boaz</st>.<n id="4" />
The tops of the pillars were shaped like lilies. So the construction of the pillars was completed.
He also made the large bronze basin called “The Sea.” It measured 15 feet from rim to rim, was circular in shape, and stood 7½ feet high. Its circumference was 45 feet.

<st data-num="08478" class="">Under</st> the <st data-num="08193" class="">rim</st> <st data-num="05439 05437">all the way around</st> it were <st data-num="06497" class="">round ornaments</st><n id="1" /> arranged in <st data-num="05362" class="">settings</st> <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st> long.<n id="2" /> The <st data-num="06497" class="">ornaments</st> were in <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> and had been <st data-num="03332 03333">cast</st> <st data-num="0854 05439">with</st> “The <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>.”<n id="3" />

“The Sea”<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on top of</st> <st data-num="08147 06240">twelve</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st>. <st data-num="07969" class="">Three</st> <st data-num="06437" class="">faced</st> <st data-num="06828" class="">northward</st>, <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">westward</st>, <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="05045" class="">southward</st>, and <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="04217" class="">eastward</st>. “The <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>” was placed <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="04605" class="">top</st> of them, and they <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0268 01004">faced outward</st>.<n id="2" />
It was four fingers thick and its rim was like that of a cup shaped like a lily blossom. It could hold about 12,000 gallons.
He also made 10 bronze movable stands. Each stand was 6 feet long, 6 feet wide, and 4½ feet high.

The <st data-num="04350" class="">stands</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">were</st> <st data-num="04639" class="">constructed</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04526" class="">frames</st> <st data-num="04526 0996">between</st> the <st data-num="07948" class="">joints</st>.

<st data-num="05921" class="">On</st> these <st data-num="04526" class="">frames</st> <st data-num="0834 0996">and</st> <st data-num="07948" class="">joints</st> were ornamental <st data-num="0738" class="">lions</st>, <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st>, and <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st>. <st data-num="05921 07948 03653 04605 08478">Under</st> the <st data-num="0738" class="">lions</st> and <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st> were <st data-num="04639 04174">decorative</st> <st data-num="03914" class="">wreaths</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="0259" class="">Each</st> <st data-num="04350" class="">stand</st> had <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="0212" class="">wheels</st> with <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="05633" class="">axles</st> and <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="06471 03802">supports</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08478" class="">Under</st> the <st data-num="03595" class="">basin</st> the <st data-num="03802" class="">supports</st> were <st data-num="03333" class="">fashioned</st> on <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> <st data-num="05676" class="">side</st> with <st data-num="03914" class="">wreaths</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01004" class="">Inside</st> the stand was a <st data-num="05696" class="">round</st> <st data-num="06310" class="">opening</st> that was <st data-num="0520" class="">18 inches</st> <st data-num="03805 04605">deep</st>; <st data-num="06310" class="">it</st> <st data-num="04639" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="03653" class="">support</st> that was <st data-num="0520 02677">27 inches</st> long.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01571 05921">On the edge of</st> the <st data-num="06310" class="">opening</st> were <st data-num="04734" class="">carvings</st> in <st data-num="07251 03808 05696">square</st> <st data-num="04526" class="">frames</st>.<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="0212" class="">wheels</st> were <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> the <st data-num="04526" class="">frames</st>, and the <st data-num="03027" class="">crossbars</st> of the <st data-num="0212" class="">axles</st> were connected to the <st data-num="04350" class="">stand</st>. <st data-num="0259" class="">Each</st> <st data-num="0212" class="">wheel</st> was <st data-num="0520 02677">27 inches</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06967" class="">high</st>.

The <st data-num="0212" class="">wheels</st> were <st data-num="04639" class="">constructed</st> <st data-num="04639" class="">like</st> <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="0212" class="">wheels</st>; their <st data-num="03027" class="">crossbars</st>, <st data-num="01354" class="">rims</st>, <st data-num="02839" class="">spokes</st>, and <st data-num="02840" class="">hubs</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">were</st> made of <st data-num="03332" class="">cast metal</st>.

<st data-num="0259" class="">Each</st> <st data-num="04350" class="">stand</st> had <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="03802" class="">supports</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">one</st> <st data-num="0702" class="">per</st> <st data-num="06438" class="">side</st> <st data-num="03802" class="">projecting out</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04350" class="">stand</st>.<n id="1" />

On <st data-num="07218" class="">top</st> of each <st data-num="04350" class="">stand</st> was a <st data-num="05696" class="">round</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">opening</st> <st data-num="02677 0520">three-quarters of a foot</st> <st data-num="06967" class="">deep</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">there were</st> also <st data-num="03027" class="">supports</st> and <st data-num="04526" class="">frames</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">top</st> of the <st data-num="04350" class="">stands</st>.

He <st data-num="06605" class="">engraved</st> ornamental <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st>, <st data-num="0738" class="">lions</st>, and <st data-num="08561" class="">palm trees</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03871" class="">plates</st> of the <st data-num="03027" class="">supports</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> <st data-num="04526" class="">frames</st> <st data-num="04626 0376">wherever there was room</st>,<n id="1" /> with <st data-num="03914" class="">wreaths</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st>.
He made the 10 stands in this way. All of them were cast in one mold and were identical in measurements and shape.
He also made 10 bronze basins, each of which could hold about 240 gallons. Each basin was 6 feet in diameter; there was one basin for each stand.
He put five basins on the south side of the temple and five on the north side. He put “The Sea” on the south side, in the southeast corner.
Hiram also made basins, shovels, and bowls. He finished all the work on the Lord’s temple he had been assigned by King Solomon.

He made<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>, the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01543" class="">bowl-shaped</st> <st data-num="03805 0834">tops</st> <st data-num="05921 07218">of</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>, the <st data-num="07639 08147">latticework</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="08147 01543">bowl-shaped</st> <st data-num="03805 0834">tops</st> <st data-num="05921 07218">of</st> the two <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>,

the <st data-num="0702 03967" class="">400</st> <st data-num="07416" class="">pomegranate-shaped ornaments</st> for the <st data-num="07639" class="">latticework</st> of the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> pillars (<st data-num="0259" class="">each</st> <st data-num="07639" class="">latticework</st> had <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> of <st data-num="07416" class="">these ornaments</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="08147 01543">bowl-shaped</st> <st data-num="03805 0834">top</st> <st data-num="05921 06440">of</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillar</st>),

the <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> movable <st data-num="04350" class="">stands</st> <st data-num="05921 04350">with</st> their <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="03595" class="">basins</st>,

the <st data-num="0259" class="">big bronze basin called</st> “The <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>” with its <st data-num="08147 06240">12</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st> <st data-num="08478 03220">underneath</st>,<n id="1" />
and the pots, shovels, and bowls. All these items King Solomon assigned Hiram to make for the Lord’s temple were made from polished bronze.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> had them <st data-num="03332" class="">cast</st> in <st data-num="0127" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="04568" class="">foundries</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="03603" class="">region</st> of the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">and</st> <st data-num="06891" class="">Zarethan</st>.
Solomon left all these items unweighed; there were so many of them they did not weigh the bronze.
Solomon also made all these items for the Lord’s temple: the gold altar; the gold table on which was kept the Bread of the Presence;

the <st data-num="05462" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="04501" class="">lampstands</st> at the <st data-num="06440" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st> (<st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> on the <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> and <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> on the <st data-num="08040" class="">left</st>); the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="06525" class="">flower-shaped ornaments</st>, <st data-num="05216" class="">lamps</st>, and <st data-num="04457" class="">tongs</st>;

the <st data-num="05462" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="05592" class="">bowls</st>, <st data-num="04212" class="">trimming shears</st>, <st data-num="04219" class="">basins</st>, <st data-num="03709" class="">pans</st>, and <st data-num="04289" class="">censers</st>; and the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st> <st data-num="06596" class="">sockets</st> for the <st data-num="06442" class="">inner</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">sanctuary</st> (the <st data-num="06944" class="">Most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st>) and for the <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> of the <st data-num="01964" class="">main hall</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.
When King Solomon finished constructing the Lord’s temple, he put the holy items that belonged to his father David (the silver, gold, and other articles) in the treasuries of the Lord’s temple.
